      Clone()
      static FlowMap FlowSpaceUtil.deleteFlowSpaceBySlice(java.lang.String sliceName)
      Remove all of the flowSpace associated with a slice Does NOT send updates to classifiers DOES lock the flowSpace for synchronization amended by ash: You cannot call remove on the iterator as this ignores the flowmaps interface and it assumes that what is returned from getRules is the actual data structure which holds the flow space def, which may not actually be the case.
      static FlowMap FlowSpaceUtil.getFlowMap(long dpid)
      Get the FlowMap.
      static FlowMap FlowSpaceUtil.getNewFlowMap(int type) 
      static FlowMap FlowSpaceUtil.getSliceFlowSpace(java.lang.String sliceName)
      Return the flowspace controlled by this slice Note that this correctly removes the "holes" caused by higher priority flowspace entries
      static FlowMap FlowSpaceUtil.getSubFlowMap(FlowMap flowMap, long dpid, FVMatch match)
      Get the FlowMap that is the intersection of this FlowMap and the given flowSpace that is, any rule in the source flowmap that matches any part of dpid and match is added to the returned flowmap
      static FlowMap FlowSpaceUtil.getSubFlowMap(long dpid)
      Get the FlowMap that is the intersection of the Master FlowSpace and this dpid
      FlowMap FederatedFlowMap.instance()

      Methods in org.flowvisor.flows with parameters of type FlowMap 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.Set<java.lang.Short> FlowSpaceUtil.getPortsBySlice(long dpid, java.lang.String slice, FlowMap flowmap)
      Consult the flowspace and return the set of ports that this slice is supposed to use on this switch This function is somewhat expensive (think DB join), so the results should be cached, and then updated when the FlowSpace signals a change OFPort.OFPP_ALL (0xfffc) is used to describe that all ports are supposed to be used.
      static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> FlowSpaceUtil.getSlicesByDPID(FlowMap flowMap, long dpid)
      Consult the FlowSpace and get a list of all slices that get connections to this switch, as specified by it's DPID This function is somewhat expensive (think DB join), so the results should be cached, and then updated when the FlowSpace signals a change
      static FlowMap FlowSpaceUtil.getSubFlowMap(FlowMap flowMap, long dpid, FVMatch match)
      Get the FlowMap that is the intersection of this FlowMap and the given flowSpace that is, any rule in the source flowmap that matches any part of dpid and match is added to the returned flowmap
